definition: at or in the very same.../suitable/adequate/fitting/proper/to replace/to regard as/to think/to pawn/(coll.) to fail (a student)
to be/to act as/manage/withstand/when/during/ought/should/match equally/equal/same/obstruct/just at (a time or place)/on the spot/right/just at
to stand/to set up/to establish/to lay down/to draw up/at once/immediately
to break/to snap/to cut off/to give up or abstain from sth/to judge/(usu. used in the negative) absolutely/definitely/decidedly

sentences.english: He said the situation was dire and that time was of the essence.
sentences.chinese: 他说，形势危急，需要当机立断。

sentences.english: We'll have to take the bull by the horns and tackle the Medicare question.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须当机立断，想办法解决医疗保险问题。

sentences.english: The responsibility of command had habituated him to making quick decisions.
sentences.chinese: 指挥的职责使他习惯于当机立断。

sentences.english: He never lets an opportunity slip; he's always on the mark.
sentences.chinese: 他总是当机立断，决不错过机会。

sentences.english: When you have reached agreement, close the deal firmly and clearly.
sentences.chinese: 一旦达成协议，当机立断结束谈判。

sentences.english: I would kill him, I wouldn't hesitate.
We need to grasp the nettle of prison reform.
sentences.chinese: 我们需要当机立断，攻破狱政改革这个难题。

definition: a blitzkrieg strategy (idiom)/to resolve sth in the shortest time possible/to get sth done quickly
(of a turn of events) not too encouraging/far from good/anything but reassuring
at top speed/at a tremendous lick
to get away from/to withdraw/to free oneself
quick witted in an emergency/able to react resourcefully
to reassign sb to a different job/to turn around/to change direction/to make a U turn
the matter should not be delayed/there's no time to lose
to observe and make sure/to check
